result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence A Muller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the court did not address if the defendant is/is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

miscConds.notes:
The court does not order the DV Surcharge.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs over the duration of probation failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges over the duration of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Defendant to undergo anger management, cognitive intervention and batters intervention program.

timeConds.notes: *Serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with huber for work and school (the court orders the defendant be allowed to earn good time credit);

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (36 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 30, 2016.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Terrence A Muller not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence A Muller in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Terrence A Muller in custody.  Taylor Kraus for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF BAIL PREVIOUSLY ORDERED REMAIN.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Terrence A Muller not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court vacates warrant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary received and filed.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($1500.00 signature bond) gj
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed. A bench warrant was issued on 1/22/16 in preliminary hearing court due to the defendant's non-appearance. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court.  Alyssa Schaller for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is called on the record at approximately 3:05 p.m.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 1/21/16.
css
Justice Point Violation report - missed telephone contact - received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Deborah W

Defendant Terrence A Muller in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Terrence A Muller in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
